DOC.brief_summary: The aim present study compare antiplaque effectiveness two commercial mouthrinses : 0.12 % Chlorhexidine alcohol base ( CLX-A ) versus dilute 0.1 % Chlorhexidine non-alcohol base 0.1 % Formaldehyde ( CLX-F ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Chlorhexidine ( CLX ) mouthrinse gold standard antiplaque solution.However , efficiency seem preserve even chlorhexidine concentration bellow 0.10 % , formulation final product may affect effectiveness . Thus , conclude study 0.12 % CLX alcohol base mouthrinse significantly effective inhibit plaque dilute 0.1 % CLX non-alcohol base contain formaldehyde mouthrinse .
DOC.criteria: give write informed consent enter study accept stop tooth clean week le 20 teeth ; presence periodontal disease presence factor plaque retention ( clinically unacceptable restoration , important carious , dental overlapping , removable prosthesis , faulty fix prosthesis , orthodontic appliance ) , associate systemic disease ( diabetes , heart disorder , blood disease , HIV infection ) , use antibiotic antiinflammatory drug late month , know allergy component mouth rinse , pregnancy , smoke
